tab1.title: Instructions
tab1.useInstructions: You need to have a UVO (Kia) or Bluelink (Hyundai) account with PIN for your car(s). Add your car as a device in Homey, and fill in the username, password and PIN. You can now see the parked location of your car, and start controlling the car from Homey (e.g. start defroster or A/C).
tab1.settingsInstructions: Homey will only receive a car status update (new location, engine state, doorlock state, etc.) after the car has just been parked, when charging just finished, or when when using the 'refresh car status' button. If the engine is on at that moment, Homey will keep getting status updates untill the engine is shut off. In the device settings you can change the interval by which the server is checked. You can also set 24/7 car status updates. WARNING: 24/7 updates will drain your 12V battery.
tab1.CloudForceTitle: Start status updates via car Bluetooth
tab1.CloudForceInstructions: For Android and iOS there are apps or automation scripts that you can use to automatically start getting live updates as soon as your phone connects to the car's Bluetooth. In this automation script you need to open a specific web-page (HTTP GET). The URL of this page can be found in the advanced device settings.
tab1.ABRPInstructions: If you want to link live data with ABRP, enter the user token in the Homey device settings. You can get a user token from the ABRP app. Settings > Detailed > Car model > Car settings > Link Homey > copy the token.
tab1.ETTHInstructions: Using Google Directions will enable more accurate Estimated Time To Home (ETTH) calculations, including actual traffic conditions. Get a key at developers.google.com/maps. Leave empty to disable Google Directions.
